items.title: N-Uniform Poincaré Inequality (Velocity Marginal, Geometric Gas)
items.content:
194: :label: thm-poincare-geometric
195: 
196: The marginal velocity distribution $\pi_N^{\text{vel}}(\mathbf{v})$ of the Geometric Gas QSD satisfies:
197: 
198: $$
199: \text{Var}_{\pi_N^{\text{vel}}}(g) \leq C_P(\rho) \sum_{i=1}^N \int |\nabla_{v_i} g|^2 d\pi_N^{\text{vel}}
200: $$
201: 
202: where:
203: 
204: $$
205: C_P(\rho) = \frac{c_{\max}^2(\rho)}{2\gamma}
206: $$

items.label: thm-lsi-geometric
items.title: N-Uniform LSI for Geometric Gas QSD
items.content:
280: :label: thm-lsi-geometric
281: 
282: The QSD $\pi_N$ of the Geometric Gas satisfies a Log-Sobolev inequality:
283: 
284: $$
285: D_{\text{KL}}(\nu \| \pi_N) \leq C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho) \cdot I(\nu \| \pi_N)
286: $$
287: 
288: where the LSI constant $C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho)$ is:
289: - **Independent of $N$** for all $N \geq 2$
items.raw_directive:
277: ### 6.1. LSI with Viscous Coupling
278: 
279: :::{prf:theorem} N-Uniform LSI for Geometric Gas QSD
280: :label: thm-lsi-geometric
281: 
282: The QSD $\pi_N$ of the Geometric Gas satisfies a Log-Sobolev inequality:
283: 
284: $$
285: D_{\text{KL}}(\nu \| \pi_N) \leq C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho) \cdot I(\nu \| \pi_N)
286: $$
287: 
288: where the LSI constant $C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho)$ is:
289: - **Independent of $N$** for all $N \geq 2$
290: - **Independent of $\nu$** for all $\nu \geq 0$ (viscous coupling is unconditionally stable)
